results:
Based on the search results, here's the comprehensive information about Dune: Part Two (2024):

## Box Office Performance

Dune: Part Two posted 2024's first big domestic and global box office opening on its way to a $183.4 million profit. The film had a very successful theatrical run:

**Opening Weekend:**
- Director Denis Villeneuve's big-budget 'Dune: Part Two' has collected $81.5 million in its domestic debut.
- At the international box office, the sequel added $97 million for a massive global tally of $178 million.

**Total Worldwide Gross:**
- Dune 2, starring Timothee Chalamet and Zendaya, has grossed a massive $710.5 million globally, becoming the highest-grossing film of 2024 so far
- In the United States, the Denis Villeneuve directorial raked in $282 million so far and $428.5 million from the foreign markets.

## Budget

According to reports, the movie was made on an estimated budget of $190 million and around $100 million more to promote it globally. However, another source mentions The sequel was primarily financed by Legendary and its production budget, previously reported to be in the $122 million range, is closer to $190

## Rotten Tomatoes Score

Buoyed by positive reviews and glowing word-of-mouth (it has a 94% on Rotten Tomatoes and "A" CinemaScore) The film also has a 93% rating on Rotten Tomatoes and a CinemaScore of A.

## Cast

The film features an ensemble cast including:
- Timothée Chalamet as Paul Atreides, the exiled Duke of House Atreides who sides with the Fremen to overthrow the tyrannical House Harkonnen · Zendaya as Chani, a young and rebellious Fremen warrior who is Paul's love interest
- Timothée Chalamet, Zendaya, Rebecca Ferguson, Josh Brolin, Stellan Skarsgård, Dave Bautista, Charlotte Rampling, and Javier Bardem reprise their roles from the first film, with Austin Butler, Florence Pugh, Christopher Walken

## Records and Achievements

- Dune 2 is not only the highest-grossing film of 2024 currently but also the highest-earning movie of Timothee Chalamet.
- Directed by Denis Villeneuve and shot on IMAX, the feature is now the 8th highest-grossing IMAX title of all time, earning $124 million globally.
- It became the first movie of the year to pass $500 Million at the global box office and swiftly took over Dune: Part One's lifetime domestic haul in just one week.

The film was delayed from its original October 2023 release date due to the Hollywood strikes, which prevented the cast from promoting the film.
